channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Palace dismisses UN report, says it can't commit on rights recommendations
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: “We firmly reject these conclusions. That being said, the Government will continue to respect its international legal obligations, including human rights.”

item.title: Philippines cited by Forbes as among 7 potential post-COVID major tourist destinations
item.author: Rosette Adel
item.description: A contributor of Forbes.com recently listed Philippines as among the seven countries which could become a major tourist destination in a post-COVID world.

item.title: Over 700 lawyers, law students worldwide oppose anti-terror bill
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: The statement collected at least 760 signatures from the Philippines, United States, United Kingdom, Italy, Belgium, Puerto Rico, Turkey, South Africa, Portugal, Switzerland and Canada.

item.title: SWS: Public transport suspension, business shutdowns hurting most families
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: The burden was found greater for 47% of families who do not own any type of vehicle.

item.title: Churches in Metro Manila start opening
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: Some Catholic churches in Metro Manila have started opening their doors to the faithful who want to hear mass, although only 10 persons are allowed inside each of the structures.

item.title: Duterte on online scammers: Drown them in Pasig
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte warned the public against online scammers who sell face masks and rip off customers at the height of the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Don’t blame us for stalled COVID aid bill — Senate
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: It’s not the fault of senators that they adjourned without passing the bill expanding coverage of the Bayanihan Act as Malacañang itself did not certify the proposed measure as urgent, Senate President Vicente Sotto III said yesterday.

item.title: 18th Congress adjourns 1st regular session
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The first regular session of the 18th Congress adjourned yesterday with the passage of several pieces of legislation, including measures to help the country cope with the impact of the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Discern merits of terror bill, public urged; 8 arrested
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: National Security Adviser Hermogenes Esperon Jr. has urged the public to discern the merits of the anti-terror bill amid widespread opposition to the proposed legislation now awaiting President Duterte’s signature.

item.title: ‘Destruction of wildlife habitats linked to spread of diseases’
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Sen. Cynthia Villar called for stricter implementation of environmental laws especially in protected areas that serve as natural habitats for wildlife, including endangered animals that contribute significantly to biodiversity.
